articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Indonesian Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Indonesian Delegation 
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the People's Consultative Assembly of Indonesia led by Speaker Sidarto Danusubroto which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday. 
					 Present there were Kim Wan Su, vice-chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly, and Nasri Gustaman, Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK. 
					
					 The head of the delegation said that supreme leader Kim Jong Un is wisely leading the drive for economic development and the improvement of the people's living standard. 
					
					 He wished the Korean people bigger successes in building a thriving socialist nation and achieving the reunification of the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Gift from Indonesian Parliament
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Gift from Indonesian Parliament 
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the People's Consultative Assembly of Indonesia. 
					 Sidarto Danusubroto, speaker of the People's Consultative Assembly of Indonesia, who is leading the visiting delegation, conveyed the gift to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Monday.

articles.title: Indonesian Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Indonesian Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the People's Consultative Assembly of Indonesia led by Speaker Sidarto Danusubroto left here on Monday.
					 It was seen off at the airport by Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK, Kil Chol Hyok and Mun Sang Min, deputies to the SPA, officials concerned, Nasri Gustaman, Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy here.

articles.title: Indonesian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Indonesian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
						
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the People's Consultative Assembly of Indonesia led by Speaker Sidarto Danusubroto Monday visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 They went round historical relics preserved with much care at the old home in Mangyongdae. 
					
					 They also visited Munsu Water Park and the Sonhung Foodstuff Factory and other places.

articles.title: Chinese Government's Special Representative Here
articles.content:
Chinese Government's Special Representative Here
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Wu Dawei, special representative of the Chinese government for the issue of the Korean Peninsula, and his party arrived here Monday.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for China
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the International Affairs Institute led by Director Jang Yun Gon left here Monday to visit China.

articles.title: Delegation of Rodong Sinmun Back Home
articles.content:
Delegation of Rodong Sinmun Back Home
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The delegation of Rodong Sinmun led by Vice Editor-in-Chief Kim Won Sok came back home Sunday after visiting China.

articles.title: Vietnamese Government Economic Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Vietnamese Government Economic Delegation Arrives
						
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The Vietnamese government economic delegation headed by Nguyen Cam Tu, vice-minister of Industry and Commerce, arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A Vietnamese government economic delegation visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Monday.
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the statues and paid homage in deep reverence for the peerlessly great men who made contributions to the global cause of independence and the development of friendly relations among countries.

articles.title: DPRK Government Gives Reception for South African Government Delegation
articles.content:
DPRK Government Gives Reception for South African Government Delegation
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government gave a reception on Monday for the visiting South African government delegation headed by Ebrahim Ebrahim Ismail, vice-minister of International Relations and Cooperation.
					 The delegation arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: Office of Japan's Sports Peace Community Association Opened in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Office of Japan's Sports Peace Community Association Opened in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- An agreement on the opening of the Pyongyang Representative Office was signed here on Monday between the DPRK-Japan Friendship Association and the Sports Peace Community Association, a specified non-profit undertaking corporation of Japan. 
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Secretary General Ma Chol Su and other members of the friendship association and from the Japanese side Kanji Inoki, member of the House of Councilors of Japan and chief director of the Sports Peace Community Association, and his party. 
					
					 Ma Chol Su and Kanji Inoki inked the agreement.
					
					 The representative office will act an agent for contacts and businesses to ensure exchange and cooperation in sports and other fields between the DPRK and Japan and thus contribute to creating the atmosphere of friendship between the two peoples.
					
					 It is located in Central District of Pyongyang.
					
					 Kanji Inoki told KCNA that he was very pleased with the opening of the representative office in Pyongyang.
					
					 Recalling international sports and cultural events and contests held between sports universities of the two countries in Pyongyang in 1995 and 2012, he expressed the will to conduct more activities of various kinds.

articles.title: Advisor to DPRK-Japan Friendship Association Meets Member of House of Councilors of Japan
articles.content:
Advisor to DPRK-Japan Friendship Association Meets Member of House of Councilors of Japan
						
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Advisor to the DPRK-Japan Friendship Association Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Monday met and had a talk with Kanji Inoki, member of the House of Councilors of Japan and chief director of the Sports Peace Community Association, a specified non-profit undertaking corporation of Japan, and his party on a visit to the DPRK.
					 Present there was Kim Song Nam, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Week of German Film Show Opens
articles.content:
Week of German Film Show Opens
						
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A week of German film show was opened with due ceremony at the Taedongmun Cinema on Monday.
					 Present at the ceremony were officials concerned, creators and artistes in the field of film art, the German ambassador to the DPRK, embassy officials and German guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 The participants watched a German feature film.

articles.title: Munsu Water Park Boasts of Tanks Designed for Children
articles.content:
Munsu Water Park Boasts of Tanks Designed for Children 
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The modernly-built Munsu Water Park, which started its service some days ago, boasts of water tanks designed exclusively for children.
					 The water tanks are decorated with sculptures of animals.
					
					 Visitors can see rainbows above the tanks, formed by sprays of water spouting from fountains of different shapes.
					
					 Frog-shaped and elephant-shaped slides are well harmonized with swings.
					
					 Pak Jong Suk, living in Taesong District, Pyongyang, told KCNA:
					
					 I am very pleasant to see my children swimming in this splendid water tank.
					
					 I am so grateful to the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, who paid deep concern to building this park in a splendid and modern way.
					
					 I will bring up my children in a creditable way so that they could repay the loving care shown by Kim Jong Un for them.
					
					 Kim Wi Song, a fourth-year pupil of Chongryu Primary School in Taedonggang District, Pyongyang, said:
					
					 I am enjoying a good time in the water park together with my mother. I am reluctant to go out.
					
					 I will frequently come here after school.

articles.title: Mushroom Cultivation Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Mushroom Cultivation Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A brisk campaign for cultivating mushroom is going on in different parts of the DPRK. 
					 A project for building a mushroom farm is progressing apace in Anju City, South Phyongan Province. The project started in September.
					
					 The ground concrete tamping and brickwork have already been finished.
					
					 Meanwhile, equipment and materials needed for the mushroom production have been procured.
					
					 Ryongrim County in Jagang Province has striven to increase its mushroom farm's capacity. 
					
					 A production building project is now going on at the final stage while the substrate production and spore cultivation are accelerated. 
					
					 The Sunchon Thermal Power Plant built its own mushroom cultivation base, putting it on a normal operation.
					
					 It pays big efforts to increasing the production of mushroom in a scientific way, while making preparations to grow mushroom in the open-air from next year. 
					
					 Mushroom production bases with a large capacity appeared also on the Hyangdong Co-op Farm in Jongphyong County of South Hamgyong Province and the Paeksok Co-op Farm in Sinchon County of South Hwanghae Province.

articles.title: Production of Processed Potato Sharply Goes up
articles.content:
Production of Processed Potato Sharply Goes up 
 Taehongdan, November 4 (KCNA) -- Production is sharply going up at the Taehongdan Potato Processing Factory in Ryanggang Province.
					 The production of varieties of processed potato has grown 1.6 times in the recent one month as compared with that in the corresponding period of last year.
					
					 The employees of the factory are operating machines in full capacity after keeping various processes dovetailed with one another.
					
					 They manufactured and installed new equipments and technologically updated various production processes, markedly increasing the yield and quality of starch and boosting the production of dehydrated starch noodle, soy sauce, vinegar and sugar, etc.
					
					 They built facilities for processing potato by-products and are turning out quality foodstuff by use of by-products.
					
					 They solved the issue of additives, cutting down the production cost and keeping the production going at a high rate. They, at the same time, built a new potato store outside.

articles.title: Legends about Mt. Kumgang (3)
articles.content:
Legends about Mt. Kumgang (3)
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A spring called Mangjangchon in the Manmulsang Valley of Mt. Kumgang tells about a legend well known among the local people.
					 Once upon a time, there lived a couple called Soebawi and Okbun in the valley. 
					
					 They eked out their living with herbs they gathered in the valley.
					
					 After the lapse of many years, they reached the age of 70 and became infirm.
					
					 One day when the old man went into the valley, he found out a spring.
					
					 As he felt so thirsty, he drank the water to his satisfaction and slept soundly.
					
					 When he awoke, he felt himself refreshed and healthy.
					
					 His wife was alarmed to see her husband, who looked so young.
					
					 The next day, the old woman made her way to the spring to drink the water.
					
					 Though it got dark, the woman did not return home. So the man left home for the spring to look for his wife.
					
					 There he found out his wife who regained her girlish appearance.
					
					 Both of them returned home together in an ecstasy of joy and lived a long life in the mountain.
					
					 Now the spring is one of the famous tourist attractions in the mountain.

articles.title: Anti-Reunification Nature of "Confidence-Building Process" Touted by S. Korean Authorities Disclosed
articles.content:
Anti-Reunification Nature of "Confidence-Building Process" Touted by S. Korean Authorities Disclosed
						
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The "confidence-building process" which the south Korean authorities touted as their "policy towards the north" is a hostile policy towards the DPRK from A to Z as it clearly reflects hostility toward fellow countrymen and their scenario to escalate the confrontation of the social systems, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in an article. 
					 The south Korean ruling quarters' talk about "changes" are prompted by their distrust of the DPRK, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 To hope for "changes" in the DPRK is as foolish an act as expecting the earth to break up. It is needless to say that the "confidence" touted by those with such daydream can never come true. 
					
					 Their "confidence-building process" is nothing but a traitorous confrontation policy to realize their ridiculous scenario of achieving the "unification of the social systems".
					
					 The puppet minister of Unification of south Korea was reported to have uttered as regards that process that "he aspired after great unification, beginning with a small unification." He means achieving "small unification" in the sense of an "economic community" and then realizing "great unification" in the sense of "political integration". It is little different from the sinister scenario for achieving "the step- by-step unification of the social systems" advocated by the successive rulers of south Korea.
					
					 This is unacceptable to everybody as it is designed to achieve "the unification of the social systems," a factor of stoking distrust and confrontation between the north and the south. Herein lie the anti-reunification nature and gravity of the "confidence-building process". 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should bear in mind that they are bound to be tried by public and Koreans for working hard to hurt someone and they are the very ones who should bring about changes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Teachers Union
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Teachers Union
						
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the puppet Ministry of Employment and Labor and Ministry of Education of south Korea deprived the progressive Teachers Union (Jongyojo) of its legitimate status as a trade union under the absurd pretext that the union continues to recognize the discharged teachers as unionists. Meanwhile, the conservative group is harshly suppressing Jongyojo on charges that it is the "enemy inside south Korea", "the core of the forces following the north" and "arch criminal who turned campuses into confusion."
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The puppet forces' crackdown upon Jongyojo is a brutal repressive campaign to eliminate the progressive and democratic forces and turn the whole land of south Korea into a theater of fascist rowdyism where justice and democracy are wantonly violated and into a society dominated by the ultra-right conservative forces.
					
					 The union has so far conducted legitimate activities as evidenced by its actions opposing the revival of the "yusin" dictatorship and disclosing the crimes the ruling forces committed by selling off the nation's interests to outside forces in solidarity with trade union organizations and democratic forces of various circles that struggled for democratic rights and right to existence.
					
					 The puppet conservative forces, regarding this as a thorn in their flesh, have persistently threatened and blackmailed the union under unreasonable pretexts. They finally declared "the trade union outside law" and decided to take a legal action against it, disclosing their sinister intention to stamp out the union.
					
					 The puppet forces' desperate efforts to stamp out the union are a trite method they employed whenever they found themselves in a predicament. This is a reckless action to tide over their ever-deepening ruling crisis and get rid of the abyss of self-destruction.
					
					 Facts go to clearly prove that the puppet forces are a group of traitors who turn south Korea into a theater of "yusin" dictatorship while regarding the fascist crackdown as an all-powerful means for their long-term office.
					
					 The present ruling forces of south Korea should bear in mind that the "yusin" dictator met a miserable end in face of the people's strenuous struggle for democracy.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps Japan's Scenario for Reinvasion
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps Japan's Scenario for Reinvasion
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Some days ago the Japanese Foreign Ministry posted a video making a "claim to Tok Islets." It made clumsy excuses that it produced and posted the video on its website to explain the historical background and reasons under international law for the purpose of letting public at home and abroad know that Tok Islets are part of "Japan's inalienable territory".
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The claim of the  Japanese reactionaries to Tok Islets was prompted by the Japanese militarists' bellicose scenario for reinvasion and wild ambition for territorial expansion, all aimed to realize their old dream of "the Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" at any cost.
					
					 Now that the islets have been confirmed to be part of the territory of Korea in name and reality in the light of geography, history and international law, there is no reason for Japan to raise a claim to the islets, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is the ulterior intention of the Japanese reactionaries to internationalize and politicize the issue of the islets in a bid to turn them into ones in dispute and thus launch reinvasion under that pretext.
					
					 The moves of the Japanese reactionaries for militarization have gone beyond the tolerance limit and their moves for overseas expansion are being pushed forward in real earnest.
					
					 At present the military muscle of Japan has been bolstered up to be aggressor forces with offensive capabilities in all services, ground, air and naval forces. What remains to be done is just to secure a pretext for invading other countries.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries regard the DPRK as their primary target of their overseas aggression. Just as the Japanese imperialists did in the past, the Japanese reactionaries are keen to realize their old dream of "the Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" using the Korean Peninsula as a springboard.
					
					 Tok Islets will as always remain part of the territory of Korea. The Japanese authorities should face up to this reality and awake from an anachronistic daydream, concludes the commentary.

articles.title: South Korean Regime Urged to Draw Lesson from Preceding Dictator's Miserable Fate
articles.content:
South Korean Regime Urged to Draw Lesson from Preceding Dictator's Miserable Fate
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Kyunghyang Daily News of south Korea carried an editorial on Nov. 2 urging the present regime to draw a lesson from the miserable fate of the Lee Myung Bak puppet group.
					 The editorial quoted Lee Myung Bak as blustering at a meeting of Chongwadae for measures  "Report to  me where the money came from for the candles and who spearheaded the rally" when the candlelight rally was staged in south Korea in 2008 in protest against the import of American beef.
					
					 The ruling party and the conservative media hatched all sorts of plots and conducted a coloring operation, claiming that the rally was manipulated by some forces behind the scene and it was not unrelated to the north's propaganda and agitation, the editorial said, and went on:
					
					 Finally the court gave an answer to the question of whether there were actually forces behind the scene five years later.
					
					 The Seoul Central District Court ruled that the suit filed by the Lee regime against the leading members of the People's Measure Council against the Total Opening of south Korean Markets to American Beef, the Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society, the Solidarity for Progress and relevant public organizations was lost. The regime "claimed damages to the police".
					
					 The editorial described the ruling as a right decision as the ruling itself amounted to admitting that the candlelight rally which  the previous regime decried and insulted as the one spearheaded by a certain specified force was a protest action taken by an overwhelming majority of citizens on their own will.
					
					 At that time the security authorities indiscriminately suppressed even the mothers who took part in the rally with their babies on the baby carriages and this meant the beginning of the fall of the Lee regime, it added.
					
					 The editorial held that its fate would have been otherwise, had the Lee regime responded to the people's will instead of resorting to the anachronistic repressive rule.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime should draw a lesson from the recent decision because the present ruling quarters started a witch hunt after labeling the opposition parties, trade unions and civic and public organizations critical of them as "leftist forces following the north", it charged.
					
					 The future of the present authorities will be gloomy, too, if they persist in their acts of taking issue with the activities of the trade unions calling for clarifying the suspected election rigging and resorting to red herrings, warned the editorial.

articles.title: S. Korean Worker Commits Suicide
articles.content:
S. Korean Worker Commits Suicide
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A worker of a company under Samsung Electronics of south Korea was found dead in Jiksan township, Chonan City, South Chungchong Province, according to the south Korean paper Hangyore on Nov. 1.
					 He opened to public the data laying bare the crimes of the manager of the company some days ago in protest against the company side's worsening maltreatment of the workers.
					
					 Displeased with this, the company side tormented him, putting all sorts of pressure on him. Not content with this, it watched and inspected him under the pretext of "formation of trade union". 
					
					 The Samsung Electronics Branch of the Metal Trade Union held that the company side's increased pressure and dire destitution drove the worker to death.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Racket of S. Korean Regime Assailed
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Racket of S. Korean Regime Assailed
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement on Oct. 30 to denounce the south Korean authorities for positively supporting and patronizing human scum's anti-DPRK smear campaign.
					 The statement said:
					
					 At the instigation and support of the south Korean conservative authorities, human scum who defected from the north opened a website mimicking the north's internet "By our nation itself". Not content with posting on the website what malignantly slanders the DPRK, they conducted a "signature campaign for the election of a new leader" through the website only to spark off the towering resentment of the nation.
					
					 Their despicable act is an unpardonable insult and unbearable challenge to not only the Korean nation but also Koreans in China.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are depending even on human scum, defectors from the north who have neither a scrap of conscience nor any sense of obligation, in pursuit of the absurd ambition for the unification of the social systems while paying lip service to the "respect" for the north-south joint declarations, "dialogue" and "sincerity." Very wretched is the plight of the authorities.
					
					 They are sadly mistaken if they calculate the farces of human scum worse than a flock of rats can shake even a little the firm faith of the DPRK and its people who remain unchanged despite all sorts of siege offensives and moves of the imperialist allied forces to isolate and stifle it century after century.
					
					 They should behave themselves, well aware of the steadfast will and spirit of the people of the country not to pardon anyone who malignantly slanders the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and its social system. 
					
					 They should take a substantial measure of closing the anti-reunification and confrontational website immediately.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Political Parties Blast S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Moves to Disband UPP
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Political Parties Blast S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Moves to Disband UPP
						
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Political parties of Bangladesh made public statements on October 28 in protest against the south Korean authorities' fascist moves to dissolve the Unified Progressive Party (UPP).
					 The Bangladesh People's League said that the south Korean authorities' moves to forcibly disband the legitimate political party are stunning the world.
					
					 The freedom of political party activities and right to political activities are guaranteed in every country of the world and left-wing political parties are conducting legitimate activities there, it noted.
					
					 It termed the above-said moves of the south Korean authorities a grave challenge and an unpardonable fascist action against an overwhelming majority of south Koreans demanding social democracy and genuine freedom of political activities.
					
					 The Central Committee of the Bangladesh Communist Party said:
					
					 The south Korean authorities advocating "freedom" of expression and "liberal democracy" are becoming frantic in their moves to forcibly dissolve the UPP for the mere reason that it called for the peaceful reunification of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Any political party of south Korea has the right to express its political view.
					
					 We view this grave situation created by the south Korean authorities as an expression of a wholesale crackdown upon the pro-reunification patriotic forces who took the lead in the struggle against conservatives and bitterly condemn it.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Suppressing Pro-reunification Patriotic Forces
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Suppressing Pro-reunification Patriotic Forces
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Friendly organizations of Russia and Peru vehemently denounced the south Korean puppet conservative group for its moves to forcibly dissolve the Unified Progressive Party (UPP).
					 The Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association of Russia said in a statement on October 28:
					
					 To disband the UPP by linking it with the DPRK clearly indicates part of the mean and fascist political farce of the present south Korean authorities to mercilessly crack down on even legitimate political parties and organizations in a bid to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen and stay in power for an indefinite period.
					
					 We bitterly condemn the south Korean authorities for their moves to forcibly dissolve the UPP, regarding them as a wholesale crackdown upon the pro-reunification patriotic forces.
					
					 The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship in an article posted on its website on October 27 noted that the moves of the south Korean ultra-right reactionary forces to disband the UPP clearly show once again who truly wants reunification and democracy.
					
					 We would like to question those ultra-right reactionary forces of south Korea keen to forcibly disorganize the UPP what type society the south Korean society is as the wishes of all Koreans to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country through dialogue after driving foreign forces out of south Korea are trampled down and the freedom of political activities of political parties and organizations is not guaranteed.

articles.title: Peruvian, Ethiopian Organizations Blast S. Korean Society under Reign of Fascism
articles.content:
Peruvian, Ethiopian Organizations Blast S. Korean Society under Reign of Fascism
 Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Peru and Ethiopia issued statements on October 28 and 29 accusing the south Korean puppet conservative group of its moves to disband the Unified Progressive Party (UPP), progressive political party.
					 The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism branded the south Korean puppet conservative group's frantic moves to forcibly disband the UPP desirous of independence, democracy and reunification, the common desire of the Korean people and world people, as a challenge to justice and truth and an act of going against the trend of history 
					
					 It said that their moves clearly indicate that south Korean society is under the reign of fascism as political freedom and human rights are ruthlessly violated there.
					
					 The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea said that the UPP is a legitimate political party reflecting the requirements of the south Korean people desirous of independence, democracy and reunification.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 It is an unpardonable provocation and challenge to the DPRK for the south Korean regime to try to disband the UPP by linking it with the DPRK.
					
					 This is aimed at eliminating all forces desirous of reunification and democracy in south Korea and seeking the long-term office of the conservative forces.
					
					 We bitterly denounce such moves of the south Korean regime.
					
					 We strongly demand the south Korean conservative forces to immediately stop their vicious moves to disband the UPP.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de Indonesia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de Indonesia
Pyongyang, 4 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, departio hoy en un ambiente amistoso en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion de la Asamblea Consultiva del Pueblo de Indonesia dirigida por su presidente Sidarto Danusubroto, que le hizo una visita de cortesia.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion Kim Wan Su, vicepresidente de la APS, y el embajador indonesio en Corea, Nasri Gustaman.
					
					El visitante dijo que Su Excelencia Kim Jong Un dirige sabiamente la lucha por lograr el desarrollo economico y el mejoramiento de los niveles de la vida del pueblo.
					
					Convencido de que se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises, deseo que bajo la guia de su lider, el pueblo coreano obtenga mayores exitos en la construccion de un Estado prospero socialista y el cumplimiento de la causa de reunificacion de la patria.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il se reune con Kanji Inoki
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il se reune con Kanji Inoki
						
Pyongyang, 4 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Kim Yong Il, asesor de la Asociacion de Amistad RPDC-Japon, departio el dia 4 con el senador Kanji Inoki, director jefe de la Asociacion de Comunidad de Deportes y Paz, corporacion especifica sin fines de lucro de Japon, y su comitiva, de visita en Corea. 
					En la ocasion estuvo presente el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Song Nam.

articles.title: RPDC y Japon acuerdan instalar oficina representative
articles.content:
RPDC y Japon acuerdan instalar oficina representativa
						
　Pyongyang, 4 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Quedo rubricado hoy aqui el acuerdo sobre la apertura de la oficina representativa de Pyongyang entre la Asociacion de Amistad RPDC-Japon y la Asociacion de Comunidad de Deportes y Paz, corporacion especifica sin fines de lucro de Japon.
					　Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion, por la parte coreana, el secretario general Ma Chol Su y otros miembros de la Asociacion de Amistad RPDC-Japon, y por la japonesa, el senador Kanji Inoki, director jefe de la Asociacion de Comunidad de Deportes y Paz, corporacion especifica sin fines de lucro de Japon y su comitiva.
					
					　Ma y Kanji firmaron el documento.
					
					　La nueva oficina instalada con la meta de crear el ambiente amistoso entre los pueblos de ambos paises, realizara sus actividades para las relaciones mutuas y el negocio suplente para llevar a cabo el intercambio y la cooperacion en varios sectores inclusive el deporte entre los dos paises.
					
					　La oficina esta enclavada en el capitalino municipio Jung.
					
					　Kanji dijo que se siente muy contento de la apertura de la Oficina Representativa en Pyongyang.
					
					　Recordo que en 1995 y 2012, se realizaron con exito en Pyongyang el acto deportivo y cultural internacional y los partidos entre los jugadores de las universidades de cultura fisica de los dos paises y expreso la voluntad de desarrollar con dinamismo tambien en el futuro diversos trabajos.

articles.title: En Pyongyang Wu Dawei y su comitiva
articles.content:
En Pyongyang Wu Dawei y su comitiva 
Pyongyang, 4 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Llegaron el dia 4 a esta capital el representante especial del gobierno chino encargado de asuntos de la Peninsula Coreana, Wu Dawei y su comitiva.
